messages.subject: Re: Patchwork of Days
messages.msgSnippet: Guess what? In my copy of the book, it goes from page 144 directly to page 177. I m missing that whole section of the book! I got ripped off! And your chapter
messages.messageBody:
Guess what? In my copy of the book, it goes from page 144 directly to
page 177. I'm missing that whole section of the book! I got ripped
off! And your chapter is in the index, Sandra, I just looked. But I
can't read your chapter. :-/

Karin

and talks

the flag of

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Patchwork of Days
messages.msgSnippet: I have a copy of Homeschooling: A Patchwork of Days and Sandra, you are NOT in it! I looked through every story several times and my edition must be one that
messages.messageBody:
I have a copy of Homeschooling: A Patchwork of Days and Sandra, you are NOT
in it! I looked through every "story" several times and my edition must be
one that you are not in. Unless I have still somehow missed it. Mine says
Copyright 1996 by Nancy Lande.

Karin



In a message dated 6/17/03 9:59:59 AM, abtleo@... writes:

<< I was intimidated by
it, really. I could never keep the schedule some of those folks do!

<<Then I discovered unschooling someplace on-line, and felt much better! >>


I know, our chapter is buried in among the many, many (many) structured
homeschoolers.

I wrote about needing to buy pink crayons for kids who were coloring Power
Rangers. <g>

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Patchwork of Days
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/19/03 12:01:08 PM, roundhouse208@juno.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/19/03 12:01:08 PM, roundhouse208@... writes:

<< I have a copy of Homeschooling: A Patchwork of Days and Sandra, you are NOT

in it! >>

I'm too lazy to go up a flight and a half of stairs, find the book, find what
page, but look, here's the quilt. We're three down, four across. What a
lame quilt block I made, huh? <g> (Not lame for New Mexico, but some of those
others sure too, more artistry and effort.)

<A HREF="http://www.windycreek.com/HomeschoolingPatchworkQuil.html">The Quilt
</A>

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Patchwork of Days
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/19/03 12:01:08 PM, roundhouse208@juno.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/19/03 12:01:08 PM, roundhouse208@... writes:

<< I have a copy of Homeschooling: A Patchwork of Days and Sandra, you are NOT

in it! I looked through every "story" several times and my edition must be

one that you are not in. Unless I have still somehow missed it. Mine says

Copyright 1996 by Nancy Lande. >>

They took out the last names. It's called "Out of Pink Crayons" and talks
all about Kirby and Marty and Holly. The picture/patch is the zia, the flag of
New Mexico, kind of a red sun on yellow.

Sandra
